original_solution_mapping.L1: She has 240 minutes to write because 4 x 60 = <<4*60=240>>240
original_solution_mapping.L2: She will write 2,400 words because 240 x 10 = <<240*10=2400>>2,400
original_solution_mapping.L3: She will earn $240 for the words because 2,400 x .1 = <<2400*.1=240>>240
original_solution_mapping.L4: She will earn $180 from the articles because 3 x 60 = <<3*60=180>>180
original_solution_mapping.L5: She will earn $420 in total because 240 + 180 = <<240+180=420>>420
original_solution_mapping.L6: She will average $105 an hour because 420 / 4 = <<420/4=105>>105

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4631.
    Returns: the expected earnings per hour.
    """
    # L1
    total_hours = 4 # in the next 4 hours
    minutes_per_hour = 60 # WK
    total_minutes = total_hours * minutes_per_hour

    # L2
    words_per_minute = 10 # She averages 10 words a minute
    total_words = total_minutes * words_per_minute

    # L3
    earnings_per_word = 0.1 # She earns $.1 per word
    earnings_from_words = total_words * earnings_per_word

    # L4
    num_articles = 3 # finish three stories
    earnings_per_article = 60 # She earns $60 per article
    earnings_from_articles = num_articles * earnings_per_article

    # L5
    total_earnings = earnings_from_words + earnings_from_articles

    # L6
    average_earnings_per_hour = total_earnings / total_hours

    # FA
    answer = average_earnings_per_hour
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: She has {total_minutes} minutes to write because {total_hours} x {minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={total_minutes}>>{total_minutes}
She will write {total_words} words because {total_minutes} x {words_per_minute} = <<{total_minutes}*{words_per_minute}={total_words}>>{total_words}
She will earn ${earnings_from_words} for the words because {total_words} x {earnings_per_word} = <<{total_words}*{earnings_per_word}={earnings_from_words}>>{earnings_from_words}
She will earn ${earnings_from_articles} from the articles because {num_articles} x {earnings_per_article} = <<{num_articles}*{earnings_per_article}={earnings_from_articles}>>{earnings_from_articles}
She will earn ${total_earnings} in total because {earnings_from_words} + {earnings_from_articles} = <<{earnings_from_words}+{earnings_from_articles}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings}
She will average ${average_earnings_per_hour} an hour because {total_earnings} / {total_hours} = <<{total_earnings}/{total_hours}={average_earnings_per_hour}>>{average_earnings_per_hour}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: She has 240 minutes to write because 4 x 60 = <<4*60=240>>240
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: She will write 2400 words because 240 x 10 = <<240*10=2400>>2400
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: She will earn $240 for the words because 2400 x 0.1 = <<2400*0.1=240>>240
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: She will earn $180 from the articles because 3 x 60 = <<3*60=180>>180
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: She will earn $420 in total because 240 + 180 = <<240+180=420>>420
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L6: She will average $60 an hour because 240 / 4 = <<240/4=60>>60

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'total_minutes' (value: 240) was used instead of 'total_earnings' (value: 420.0).
